page.title: 06Guilsborough Grange Animals.
page.content: Situated about 1/2 a mile along the road to West Haddon,the park is open all the year round.It opened in 1971 with a few private pets and now has 400 animals and birds.The livestock surround the attractive Regency style house,parts of which date back to the 18th century.When the village was enclosed in 1746 the Grange was the centre of a 350 acre estate.Between 1870 and 1939 the estate was occupied by keen hunting folk needing accomodation in the Pytchley Hunt area. Like many country houses the Grange was taken over by the army in WW2.The charming stableyard now contains the Kalli picture exhibition, Tea rooms and a gift shop.Exhibits now include big cats,deer,water fowl,birds of prey,seals,monkeys,otters and parrots.
